metadata.title: CVE-2022-0435 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description: A stack overflow flaw was found in the Linux kernel's TIPC protocolfunctionality in the way a user sends a packet with malicious content wherethe number of domain member nodes is higher than the 64 allowed. This flawallows a remote user to crash the system or possibly escalate theirprivileges if they have access to the TIPC network.

criterions.comment: linux-lts-xenial: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-aws: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-azure: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
